New Records: Georgia's first ever qualification for the knockout stages of a major international tournament as an independent nation
Khvicha Kvaratskhelia's goal after 01:32 is both Georgia's fastest ever goal scored at the UEFA European Championship and the earliest Portugal have ever conceded in the competition
Georges Mikautadze has scored in all three of Georgia's group matches, becoming only the ninth player to score in all three group matches at a European Championship
Key Match Events: Khvicha Kvaratskhelia's goal in the 2nd minute
Georges Mikautadze's penalty kick goal in the 48th minute
Pre-Game Insights: Georgia were seen as little more than the likely also-rans of Euro 2024 coming into the tournament
Portugal's confirmed status as group winners even before a ball was kicked
Post-Match Reflections: Willy Sagnol, Georgia coach, praised his team’s resilience and performance
Roberto Martínez, Portugal coach, expressed disappointment with the team's performance and conceded early goals
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was Georgia's first ever qualification for the knockout stages of a major international tournament as an independent nation
Portugal's confirmed status as group winners even before a ball was kicked
Others: The match was played at Arena AufSchalke in Gelsenkirchen
Georgia stunned Group F winners Portugal to reach the last 16 of Euro 2024
